350.article_body: An interfaith couple arrived at a sub-registrar's office in Karnataka and legally registered their marriage a week after they were allegedly attacked by Bajrang Dal activists. The couple said they were childhood friends and did not intend to change their religion. Police reportedly provided security to the couple and took them to the police station after the attack.

351.title: Team India's new jersey launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, pic released
351.article_body: Team India's new T20I kit called 'One Blue Jersey' has been launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. The new jersey has a lighter shade of blue. The jersey was launched by BCCI and Team India's official kit sponsor, MPL Sports, at an event in Mumbai. Team India are expected to wear the jersey starting with T20I series against Australia.

352.title: Arsenal regain top Premier League spot with 3-0 win over Brentford
352.article_body: Arsenal regained top spot in the Premier League standings with a 3-0 win over Brentford on Sunday. Both William Saliba and Gabriel Jesus scored in the first half. Fabio Vieira, on his full Premier League debut, scored the third in the 49th minute. Arsenal have 18 points from seven matches. They are one point ahead of Manchester City and Tottenham.

353.title: BJP wins in West Bengal's Nandigram cooperative body polls
353.article_body: BJP won the polls in a cooperative body in Nandigram in West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district. The saffron party won 11 of the 12 seats of Bhekutia Samabay Krishi Samity. Notably, TMC, which earlier ruled the cooperative body, won only a single seat, a district official said. The MLA from the Nandigram constituency is BJP's Suvendu Adhikari.

354.title: 8-ft-long python swallows goat in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve
354.article_body: An eight-foot-long python swallowed a goat in a village in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve, a forest official said on Sunday. The python, which was not able to move, was rescued by a four-member team with help of villagers and was later released into the forest. The goat was in a maize field when the python attacked and swallowed it.

355.title: I'm sorry I killed the characters so easily: 'Squid Game' director
355.article_body: 'Squid Game' director Hwang Dong-hyuk, speaking about season 2 of the series, has said he feels sorry for easily killing many characters in the first season. "I want to revive Ji-young, but her best friend Sae-byeok also died, so I'm thinking what to do," he stated. The upcoming season is expected to release in 2024.

356.title: There's no way Kohli has to open batting for India in T20 WC: Hayden
356.article_body: Sharing his opinion on whether Virat Kohli should open the batting for India in upcoming T20 World Cup, Matthew Hayden said, "There's no way that he has to open the batting, he has to bat at number three, [as] simple as that." Kohli recently scored 122* in Asia Cup 2022 while opening against Afghanistan. It was Kohli's first-ever T20I century.

357.title: Death toll due to Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border clashes reach 81
357.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Sunday updated their death tolls from the latest bout of border skirmishes between them, putting the combined figure at 81. Tajik and Kyrgyz forces clashed multiple times from September 14-16. Both sides have accused each other of using heavy weaponry such as tanks and mortars. A fragile ceasefire between the two countries is currently in effect.

358.title: Where and when will Queen Elizabeth be laid to rest tomorrow?
358.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II will be laid to rest at St George's Chapel located inside Windsor Castle in Berkshire, UK tomorrow. Her coffin will be transported to her final resting place in the chapel after a state funeral at the Westminster Abbey in London. The funeral is scheduled to begin at 3:30 PM (IST) and is expected to last an hour.

359.title: OTT has changed things for me: Tisca Chopra
359.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said in an interview that OTT has changed things for her. She added that OTT is a very democratic medium since the sustainability of an actor only depends on their ability to perform a given job. "It is very liberating as an actor. It is definitely going to be a great decade ahead," Tisca further said.

360.title: Language isn't barrier now, people watch films with subtitles: Naga
360.article_body: Speaking about the North vs South debate, actor Naga Chaitanya said language is not a barrier anymore and people watch films with subtitles. Naga further stated that nothing is going wrong with Bollywood. "The audience picks the content they can relate to the most. If there's an emotional connection, they'll make it win, be it in any language," he added.

361.title: Azerbaijan rebukes Pelosi over remarks on conflict with Armenia
361.article_body: Azerbaijan on Sunday criticised US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi for blaming Baku for the renewed fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "Unsubstantiated and unfair accusations levelled by Pelosi...are unacceptable," Azerbaijan's foreign ministry said. Her remarks dealt a "serious blow" to efforts aimed at normalisation of ties between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the ministry added.

362.title: Our timelines couldn't match: Ali on not directing Salman, Katrina's Tiger 3
362.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar, who helmed 'Tiger Zinda Hai', spoke about not directing 'Tiger 3' which stars Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif. "Adi (producer Aditya Chopra) is like an elder brother...When the third part of 'Tiger' was happening I'd some engagements that I was committed to. Our timelines couldn't match," he said. 'Tiger 3' is being helmed by Maneesh Sharma.

363.title: Chandigarh University announces non-teaching days on Sept 19 & 20 amid protests
363.article_body: Amid huge protests over the video leak incident on its campus, Chandigarh University on Sunday declared September 19 (Monday) and 20 (Tuesday) as non-teaching days for students due to some "unavoidable reasons". However, all faculty and staff members of academic and non-academic departments will report as usual. A notification added that other essential services will continue.

364.title: ONGC bats to remove windfall tax, use dividend to tap into earnings
364.article_body: State-owned ONGC, India's top producer of oil and gas, wants the central government to remove windfall profit tax on crude oil that is produced domestically. Instead, ONGC wants that the dividend be used to tap into earnings from surge in global energy prices. It also said that levying windfall tax was unfair while reaping savings from purchasing discounted Russian oil.

365.title: Shimla man who got 'objectionable videos' from Chandigarh University student arrested
365.article_body: A man from Shimla has been arrested in connection to the leak of objectionable videos of Chandigarh University's female students, police said on Sunday. This is the second arrest in the case as a girl student, who allegedly made the videos and sent them to the apprehended man, was arrested earlier. Police said the arrested student sent her own video.

366.title: NCW writes to Punjab Police over Chandigarh University video leak incident
366.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) on Sunday wrote to Punjab DGP to immediately file an FIR into the video leak incident at Chandigarh University. NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma also wrote to the university vice chancellor to take stringent action against the accused. Massive protests erupted on the university campus over alleged rumours of objectionable videos of women students being recorded.

367.title: Noida policemen take bribe to let off drug trafficking suspect; 3 suspended
367.article_body: Three Noida Police personnel have been suspended and one of them has been arrested for allegedly taking money from a person to let him off the hook in a drug trafficking case. The accused officials were posted at the Sector 57 outpost and action was initiated after a video purportedly showing a constable taking a ₹20,000 bribe went viral.

368.title: Kohli will be a challenge this next week: Cummins ahead of India-Aus T20Is
368.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli ahead of India-Australia T20I series, Australia pacer Pat Cummins said the India batter is going to be a challenge in the next week. On Kohli ending his 1,019-day international century drought at recently concluded Asia Cup 2022, Cummins said, "He's a class player, he was always going to return to form at some point in time."

369.title: Indian man flies to Dubai to buy iPhone 14, spends ₹40,000 on tickets & visa
369.article_body: A 28-year-old Kerala man flew to Dubai to be among the first few Indians to buy iPhone 14 Pro, just hours before its sale began in India on Friday (September 16). Dheeraj Palliyil bought its 512 GB storage model for ₹1,29,000. This was the fourth time that Palliyil purchased the latest iPhone on its first day of sale in Dubai.

370.title: President Murmu pays tribute to Queen in London, signs condolence book; pics surface
370.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday visited Westminster Hall in London, where the body of Queen Elizabeth II is lying in state. President Murmu offered tributes on her own behalf and on behalf of the people of India, the President’s Secretariat tweeted. She also signed the condolence book in the memory of the Queen Elizabeth II at Lancaster House in London.

371.title: Ex-students held for crude bomb explosion on roof of Bengal school
371.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested four boys, aged between 17 and 18, for allegedly throwing a crude bomb on the roof of a school in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas during class hours on Saturday. "Three of the accused are former students of the school...Ten similar crude bombs were seized from the home of one of the suspects," an officer said.

372.title: 7 Bihar policemen including SHOs hurt as mob attacks police station
372.article_body: Seven police personnel, including two Station House Officers (SHOs), were critically injured after a group of villagers attacked the Pranpur police station in Bihar's Katihar district on Saturday, hours after the death of a man allegedly in custody. Hundreds of villagers allegedly damaged vehicles parked on the premises. The deceased was arrested on Friday for possessing bottles of liquor.

373.title: Powerful typhoon with 230 kmph wind speed hits Japan
373.article_body: A powerful typhoon 'Nanmadol' with wind speed of over 230 kmph made landfall in southwestern Japan on Sunday. The Japan Meteorological Agency issued special warning for Kagoshima Prefecture. Notably, such warnings are only issued when "extraordinary" natural phenomenon occurring once in a few decades is predicted in the country. The typhoon officially made landfall at around 7 pm (local time).

374.title: There can't be Opp'n unity without Congress as its fulcrum: Jairam Ramesh
374.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said there cannot be any Opposition unity without "Congress as its fulcrum". "If any non-BJP outfit thinks any alliance sans Congress can provide a stable government for five years, it's living in a fool's paradise. There can never be any Opposition unity minus Congress," Ramesh added. Many regional parties have back-stabbed Congress, he said.

375.title: Congress to fight civic polls in Pune alone: Arvind Shinde
375.article_body: Congress' Pune unit chief Arvind Shinde has announced that the party will contest the upcoming civic elections for Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) alone, without allying with NCP or Shiv Sena. "We have asked all aspirants wanting to contest polls and other workers to start preparing for elections and focus on strengthening the party at ward level," said Shinde.

376.title: Rajasthan man in ICU after alleged brutality during police custody
376.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Sikar district is in the ICU ward after allegedly being beaten up in police custody and made to do 500 sit-ups. The victim's family submitted a memorandum to the Superintendent of Police, who has ordered a probe into the matter. The SP said the accused had been undergoing kidney dialysis and doctors have reported no injuries.

377.title: Egypt to increase transit fees for ships using Suez Canal
377.article_body: Egypt on Saturday said that it will be raising the transit fees for ships passing through the Suez Canal from January 1 next year. The Suez Canal Authority said that a 15% hike will be imposed for tankers carrying oil and petroleum products. For dry bulk carriers and cruise ships, transit fees will be increased by 10%, the authority added.

378.title: God sent AAP to end corruption like Krishna was sent to end evil: Kejriwal
378.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said, "Like lord Krishna was sent to end evil, god has sent AAP to end corruption, inflation, unemployment and save the constitution and country from evils." He was speaking at AAP's first national convention on Sunday. Around 1,500 elected representatives of AAP from around 20 states were present.

379.title: Man shoots dog dead for barking at him in Bengaluru; case filed
379.article_body: A man shot a dog in the head with an air gun for barking at him in Bengaluru's Maragondanahalli on Sunday. According to police, the accused, Krishnappa, had followed the dog before shooting it in the village. The dog was nursed by Harish, who belonged to the same village. Harish later lodged a complaint with police over the incident.

380.title: It'd be special: Murray on playing with Federer in Swiss' last event at Laver Cup
380.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray said playing with Roger Federer in the 20-time Grand Slam champion's last tournament at next week's Laver Cup would be "special". "I don't know how much he'll be able to play...haven't spoken to him about that," he added. The 41-year-old Swiss announced that he'll retire after Laver Cup. Murray and Federer will represent Team Europe.

381.title: Current policy stance should continue, expect more rate hikes: Ex-RBI Guv
381.article_body: RBI's current policy stance should continue, said former RBI Governor C Rangarajan. "Developed countries are also taking steep rate hikes. I expect more rate hikes," Rangarajan added. He further said there was a steep fall in INR's value against USD with the outflow of capital. "Now, with the inflow of capital, value of INR is expected to strengthen," he added.

382.title: US court bars social media firms from censoring users on 'viewpoint'
382.article_body: A US appeals court on Friday upheld a Texas law barring social media firms from banning or censoring users based on "viewpoint". The firms that challenged the law included the Computer and Communications Industry Association, which counts Facebook, Twitter and YouTube as its members. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton hailed the ruling as a "massive victory for...free speech".

383.title: ATS detains Maoist with 31 cases, ₹15 lakh reward in Mumbai's Nalasopara
383.article_body: The Maharashtra ATS has detained an alleged member of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) from Mumbai's Nalasopara. The man had come for medical treatment from Jharkhand and is said to have 31 cases, including 11 murders, filed against him. ATS said the man carries a reward of ₹15 lakh and will be handed over to Jharkhand Police.

384.title: Digital market distortions need to be quickly fixed: CCI Chairman
384.article_body: Competition Commission of India Chairperson Ashok Kumar Gupta said the distortions in the digital market need to be corrected promptly. Stating that digital platforms are in a position to influence consumer choices, he said the gatekeeper position of these platforms is raising competition concerns. He added that the regulatory framework also needed to adapt to reflect digital market complexities.

385.title: BJP trying to crush AAP in name of fighting corruption: Kejriwal
385.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "crush" the AAP in the name of fighting corruption. Kejriwal further alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government has been trying to frame his party leaders and ministers in false corruption cases as the BJP is "not able to digest the growing popularity of the AAP in Gujarat".

386.title: Net direct tax collections in FY23 surge 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh cr
386.article_body: Net direct tax collections in FY23 have surged 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh crore against ₹5.68 lakh crore collected in FY22, according to data from the Central Board of Direct Taxes. While ₹3.68 lakh crore was collected as corporation tax, ₹3.30 lakh crore was collected as income tax. Refunds worth ₹1.35 lakh crore have been issued till September 17.

387.title: You made my day: Mrunal to Polish fan who praised her performance in 'Sita...'
387.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur reacted to a letter sent by a Polish fan to the team of 'Sita Ramam'. In the letter, the fan praised Mrunal's performance in the film, saying that she can't imagine anyone else playing Sita. "I can't express in words how happy I am! You certainly made my day...a big thank you," Mrunal wrote.

388.title: Without jobs there is no future: Rahul Gandhi
388.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that the "Bharat Jodo Yatra is uniting the voices of despair to break the shackles of unemployment". "Without harmony, there is no progress...Without progress, there are no jobs...Without jobs, there is no future," Rahul said. The 52-year-old politician is currently participating in over 5-month long 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

389.title: Should only be inspired by it: Ranbir on Alia working during pregnancy
389.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about his wife and actress Alia Bhatt working during her pregnancy, has said that people should only be inspired by it. "Any kind of criticism is just jealousy and mischief makers and stupidity and we should not take that seriously," he added. The 'Brahmastra' actress announced her pregnancy in June.

390.title: There was no sense of hierarchy with Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan: Ankur
390.article_body: Speaking about working with Kriti Sanon and Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actor Ankur Rathee has said that there was no hierarchy. "We think that once you achieve stardom, you keep everyone at an arm's length distance. But with Kriti...Kartik, I didn't feel it at all," he added. Ankur stated Kriti and Kartik were "welcoming" when he arrived on the set.

391.title: Om Puri used to get angry if we shot after midnight: Sudhir Mishra
391.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra recalled that late actor Om Puri would get angry if they shot after midnight. He added, "He would be angry but would say, 'Chal ghar pe [Let's go home], I'll feed you bhindi'. My films are mostly set in night, so he would get angry!" Sudhir went on to call Om a "graceful" and "generous" person.

392.title: It'll be made, he has given me a hefty amount: Farah on film with Rohit
392.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan, while sharing an update on her upcoming project with Rohit Shetty, said, "Our film will be made but that's all I can say at this moment." She added that Rohit has given her a "hefty signing amount" and is refusing to take it back. The upcoming comedy entertainer will be produced by Rohit and directed by Farah.

393.title: He has proven himself: Rohit on Umesh's inclusion in India's T20I team vs Aus
393.article_body: Explaining the reason behind Umesh Yadav's selection in India's squad for upcoming three-match T20I series against Australia, India captain Rohit Sharma said the 34-year-old pacer is a quality bowler and has proven himself. Umesh was named as Mohammad Shami's replacement for the series after the pacer tested positive for COVID-19. Umesh last played a T20I in February 2019.

394.title: Condition of roads under my dept extremely bad: Maha PWD Minister
394.article_body: Maharashtra PWD Minister Ravindra Chavan said the condition of roads under his department is "extremely bad" with 40% of the roads being "in their worst condition". "If I am to ensure that all 98,000-kilometre roads are improved...then I will require ₹2 lakh crore," said Chavan. He added that PWD now needs to concentrate on the quality of roads over quantity.

395.title: Amanatullah Khan's supporters booked for heckling, obstructing ACB
395.article_body: A case has reportedly been filed against AAP leader Amanatullah Khan's supporters for heckling officers of the Delhi Anti-Corruption Bureau and causing obstruction during government work. Delhi Police lodged two FIRs against the AAP MLA's aides Hamid Ali and Kausar Imam Siddique. Khan was arrested and sent to four-day custody in connection with alleged corruption in the Delhi Waqf Board.

396.title: Chandigarh University girl sent only her video to boyfriend, other girls panicked: Police
396.article_body: Referring to reported leak of videos of around 60 Chandigarh University girls taking baths, the police stated that the accused girl sent only her video to her boyfriend in Shimla. "Other girls in the hostel saw the accused shooting her own video...They panicked and thought she shot the videos of all others,” Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said.

397.title: No objection to survey of madrassas by UP govt: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
397.article_body: Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's President Maulana Arshad Madani has said there's no objection from the madrassas on the issue of the survey of unrecognised madrassas by Uttar Pradesh government. "There's no anger in...Muslim society about the survey," he said. "[Government] can do whatever it feels is in the national interest but there should be no efforts to target...Muslims," he added.

398.title: Leopard cub with no injury marks found dead inside Mumbai's Film City
398.article_body: A leopard cub, with no visible injury marks, was found dead inside Mumbai's Film City on Sunday. Forest officials dispatched a team to figure out the cause of death after they got a call around 10:30 am on Sunday. The Sanjay Gandhi National Park, which is home to a number of leopards, is near Film City's Goregaon location.

399.title: Dams reduce water release, bring relief for Pune's low-lying areas
399.article_body: Owing to reduced rainfall activity in the catchments, dams in the vicinity of Pune have decreased their water release, bringing relief for low-lying areas that were on flood alert. PMC authorities have said that the relocation of residents in these areas has been put on hold. The state irrigation agency said that precipitation was still entering the dams on Saturday.

400.title: India 2 spots down in global crypto adoption, ranks 4th in 2022: Report
400.article_body: India slid two spots on the list of countries with highest adoption of cryptocurrencies in 2022 to the fourth position, research published by Chainalysis showed. Vietnam holds the top position, followed by the Philippines, Ukraine and the US in the second, third and fifth positions. China has ranked among top 10 countries this year after being ranked 13th last year.
